articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: In a season of severe disappointment for Rangers, what happened over the weekend can at least give some optimism for the 2023/24 campaign.
articles.title: Rangers-Celtic final word: The magnificent Cantwell, Postecoglou's deputies show weakness, Morelos and Lovelace

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: The SWPL title race will go down to the final round of fixtures next weekend with Glasgow City holding the advantage after a 2-1 victory over Partick Thistle.
articles.title: SWPL title race goes to gripping final day - Glasgow City hold slender advantage over Rangers and Celtic

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Ange Postecoglou is a “good enough” manager for the Premier League and will want to manage in the English top-flight, according to Pat Nevin.
articles.title: 'A team like Leeds' - Ange Postecoglou Premier League job claim as pundit expresses Celtic hope

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Celtic defender Cameron Carter-Vickers has not a put a timeline on his return to first-team action after having knee surgery but says he is feeling “positive” about his recovery.
articles.title: Cameron Carter-Vickers gives update on knee surgery but no date set for Celtic return

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: It felt as if a collective weight was lifted off Rangers as a club courtesy of Michael Beale’s men conjuring up a zestful 3-0 slapdown of their Celtic rivals. It certainly provided respite for the Ibrox manager, and food for thought.
articles.title: Rangers-Celtic reaction: Beale will mount title challenge; Pope pilloried; Barbour’s bizarre Sky take

articles.author: Graeme Macpherson
articles.description: Charlie Reilly is the poster boy for the power of perseverance. Rubbing shoulders the other day with a clutch of Celtic players and Motherwell striker Kevin van Veen as one of the nominees for the PFA Scotland awards, the Albion Rovers forward looked as incongruous as a penguin in the Sahara.
articles.title: Meet the Albion Rovers youngster keeping company with Celtic and Rangers

articles.author: Graham Bean
articles.description: Gregor Townsend went into this season’s Six Nations thinking it was going to be his last in charge of Scotland, and France was a realistic option for the coach before he put pen to paper on a new deal at Murrayfield.
articles.title: Scotland boss opens up on approach from French club and Ange Postecoglou Celtic talks

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: It was the day Michael Beale, whatever any public he may have made, will have craved for more than five months.
articles.title: Rangers finally have their day: Ravenous Ibrox crowd devours win as Celtic resemble old bouquet of flowers

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: Celtic manager Ange Postecoglou declared the most egregious element of his side’s 3-0 loss to Rangers was that they seemed to give up in the encounter in the second period.
articles.title: Ange Postecoglou makes stark Celtic admission after Rangers loss, comments on Oh and tells new boys 'you don't get an easy ride'

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Rangers and Celtic meet for the final time in the 2022/23 campaign at Ibrox, with the newly-crowned Premiership champions looking to go a whole season undefeated against their Glasgow rivals.
articles.title: Old Firm late team news: Rangers to make huge call at both ends of pitch, Celtic's major boost, probable XIs

articles.author: Moira Gordon
articles.description: Living in the moment, the primary concern for Celtic is Saturday afternoon’s trip to Ibrox. That’s where more bragging rights and the opportunity to navigate the season unbeaten by their Glasgow rivals is at stake.
articles.title: 'When you rhyme off those milestones ...' - Callum McGregor explains what underpins his Celtic success

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: Little could be more telling as to the trajectory of Alfredo Morelos’ Rangers career than what could await him when Celtic are hosted at Ibrox come Saturday lunchtime.
articles.title: The Ballad of Alfie: Closing refrains are melancholy - Rangers legacy, Beale's view, Celtic clashes

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: Rangers midfielder Todd Cantwell has certainly been a man making headlines since his January transfer window arrival.
articles.title: Rangers midfielder Todd Cantwell unrepentant over Celtic water-bottle incident

articles.author: Alan Pattullo
articles.description: Ange Posteocoglou insists he can’t get hung up on Rangers’ failure to grant Celtic a guard of honour at Ibrox because he regards such gestures as superficial in any case.
articles.title: Ange Postecoglou on Rangers guard of honour debate as he details text messages from managers

articles.author: Alan Pattullo
articles.description: Victory over Hearts last weekend precluded the possibility of Celtic securing the title at Ibrox on Saturday afternoon.
articles.title: 'Packed bags last year': Celtic boss on Rangers psychological warfare and how he 'took a moment' after title

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Celtic manager Ange Postecoglou spoke to the broadcast media on Friday lunchtime ahead of Saturday’s final derby of the season against Rangers.
articles.title: 'They are taking punts': Ange Postecoglou on Celtic transfer talk, impact of Rangers run and PFA nomination

articles.description: Celtic face Rangers for the sixth time this season when the Scottish champions travel to Ibrox in the Scottish Premiership.
articles.title: What channel is Rangers v Celtic on? Premiership match info, TV details, kick-off time, team news, referee

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: PFA Scotland has announced the four nominees for Manager of the Year with Ange Postecolgou in the running to retain the award he won last year. The Celtic boss is joined on the shortlist by St Mirren manager Stephen Robinson, Dunfermline Athletic’s James McPake and Darren Young of Stirling Albion.
articles.title: Celtic boss amongst 4-man Manager of the Year shortlist including Premiership top-six rival and league winners

articles.author: Moira Gordon
articles.description: Despite arriving in Scotland two years ago, Celtic’s Liel Abada admits that it took him a while to learn English. But he has recently become fluent in dealing with questions about his future.
articles.title: 'Right now I'm at Celtic': Liel Abada breaks silence on future and reveals constant chats with ex-teammate
